newsitem.title: SPAIN: Renault's Spain unit hopes EC will unblock funds.
newsitem.headline: Renault's Spain unit hopes EC will unblock funds.

text.p: Fasa Renault, the Spanish unit of French carmaker Renault said on Thursday that it hadn't lost hope that the European Commission would unblocked up a Spanish subsidy of two billion pesetas.
"The decision is up to Brussels, but we hope they will unblock the aide," a Fasa Renault spokesman told Reuters.

European competition commissioner Karel Van Miert said earlier he would block the Spanish subsidy, designed for the modernisation of the Fasa Renault plant in Valladolid, until the carmaker reconsidered plans to close its Vilvoorde factory near Brussels.
The Valladolid plant, which has a staff of some 5,200 employees, produces Twingo, Clio and Express models.
Renault plans to hire 500 additional workers to increase its production capacity to 1,200 vehicles a day in 1998 from a current 865.
The spokesman said the group had made prior requests for subisdies in Spain without these causing any problems.
He added that aide of six billion pesetas for a Renault engine factory in Valladolid was currently being paid, while a Seville plant was receiving one billion pesetas in aide.
In addition to these factories, Fasa Renault also has a plant in Palencia.
